parameters.name: key.key
parameters.description: key is the event data identifier

parameters.name: key.timestamp
parameters.description: timestamp is the time the event occured

parameters.name: time
parameters.description:
Time indicates the time for which you are interested in the data.
If no time is given, the server will use the time at which it makes the request.

parameters.name: key.key
parameters.description: key is the event data identifier

parameters.name: key.timestamp
parameters.description: timestamp is the time the event occured

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
EventAnnotationConfig carries the value to set into the datastore.
See the documentation on the EventAnnotationConfig struct for which fields are required.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description:
value contains a list of EventAnnotationConfig values to write.
It is possible to provide more values than can fit within either:
    - the maxiumum send size of the client
    - the maximum receive size of the server
If this error occurs you must reduce the number of values sent.
See gRPC "maximum message size" documentation for more information.

arista.event.v1.ComponentType.description:
- COMPONENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: COMPONENT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED is the default value, if the type is not specified.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_DEVICE: COMPONENT_TYPE_DEVICE is used for device events.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_INTERFACE: COMPONENT_TYPE_INTERFACE is used for device interface events.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_TURBINE: COMPONENT_TYPE_TURBINE is used for events on the internal CVP turbine
components. A turbine is an internal CV streaming analytics backend process.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_DVS: COMPONENT_TYPE_DVS is used for DVS events.
A vSphere Distributed Switch provides centralized management and
monitoring of the networking configuration of all workload servers that are
associated with the switch.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_DVS_INTERFACE: COMPONENT_TYPE_DVS_INTERFACE is used for DVS interface events.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_VM: COMPONENT_TYPE_VM is used for VM events.
A VM is a software computer that, like a physical computer, runs an
operating system and applications.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_VM_INTERFACE: COMPONENT_TYPE_VM_INTERFACE is used for VM interface events.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER: COMPONENT_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER is used for workload server events.
A workload server is a server/data storage device on which the hypervisor is installed.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER_INTERFACE: COMPONENT_TYPE_WORKLOAD_SERVER_INTERFACE is used for workload server interface events.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_APPLICATION: COMPONENT_TYPE_APPLICATION is used for application-service events.
 - COMPONENT_TYPE_CVP_NODE: COMPONENT_TYPE_CVP_NODE is used for CVP node events.
arista.event.v1.ComponentType.title: ComponentType describes the type of entity on which the event occured

read.title: read is the read state of an event. Setting this implies that an event has been read by a user

arista.event.v1.EventAnnotationConfig.description:
NOTE: Either 1) key and ack or 2) key and notes or 3) key and read are
      required when used as an argument to Set.
arista.event.v1.EventAnnotationConfig.title: EventAnnotationConfig configures an event annotation

type.description: This describes the class of delete error.

error.description: This indicates the error message from the delete failure.

key.description: This is the key of the EventAnnotationConfig instance that failed to be deleted.

time.description: Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp when the key was being deleted.

key.description: Key echoes back the key of the deleted EventAnnotationConfig instance.

time.description:
- it is after the time the request was received
   - a time-ranged query with StartTime==DeletedAt will not include this instance.
time.title:
Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp at which the system recognizes the
deletion. The only guarantees made about this timestamp are:

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

time.description:
Time carries the (UTC) timestamp of the last-modification of the
EventAnnotationConfig instance in this response.

value.description:
Value carries all the values given in the EventAnnotationConfigSetRequest as well
as any server-generated values.

time.description:
- it is after the time the request was received
   - a time-ranged query with StartTime==CreatedAt will include this instance.
time.title:
Time indicates the (UTC) timestamp at which the system recognizes the
creation. The only guarantees made about this timestamp are:

partialEqFilter.description:
PartialEqFilter provides a way to server-side filter a GetAll/Subscribe.
This requires all provided fields to be equal to the response.

While transparent to users, this field also allows services to optimize internal
subscriptions if filter(s) are sufficiently specific.

time.description:
TimeRange allows limiting response data to within a specified time window.
If this field is populated, at least one of the two time fields are required.

For GetAll, the fields start and end can be used as follows:

  * end: Returns the state of each EventAnnotationConfig at end.
    * Each EventAnnotationConfig response is fully-specified (all fields set).
  * start: Returns the state of each EventAnnotationConfig at start, followed by updates until now.
    * Each EventAnnotationConfig response at start is fully-specified, but updates may be partial.
  * start and end: Returns the state of each EventAnnotationConfig at start, followed by updates
    until end.
    * Each EventAnnotationConfig response at start is fully-specified, but updates until end may
      be partial.

This field is not allowed in the Subscribe RPC.

value.description:
Value is a value deemed relevant to the initiating request.
This structure will always have its key-field populated. Which other fields are
populated, and why, depends on the value of Operation and what triggered this notification.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of this EventAnnotationConfig's last modification.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the EventAnnotationConfig value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

value.description:
Value is the value requested.
This structure will be fully-populated as it exists in the datastore. If
optional fields were not given at creation, these fields will be empty or
set to default values.

time.description:
Time carries the (UTC) timestamp of the last-modification of the
Event instance in this response.

arista.event.v1.EventSeverity.description:
- EVENT_SEVERITY_UNSPECIFIED: EVENT_SEVERITY_UNSPECIFIED is the default value, if the severity is not specified.
 - EVENT_SEVERITY_INFO: EVENT_SEVERITY_INFO is used for generally useful information.
 - EVENT_SEVERITY_WARNING: EVENT_SEVERITY_WARNING is used for potentially harmful conditions.
 - EVENT_SEVERITY_ERROR: EVENT_SEVERITY_ERROR is used for errors events that may allow for continued functioning.
 - EVENT_SEVERITY_CRITICAL: EVENT_SEVERITY_CRITICAL is used to designate severe errors that impede functioning.
arista.event.v1.EventSeverity.title: EventSeverity is the severity level of the event

partialEqFilter.description:
PartialEqFilter provides a way to server-side filter a GetAll/Subscribe.
This requires all provided fields to be equal to the response.

While transparent to users, this field also allows services to optimize internal
subscriptions if filter(s) are sufficiently specific.

time.description:
TimeRange allows limiting response data to within a specified time window.
If this field is populated, at least one of the two time fields are required.

For GetAll, the fields start and end can be used as follows:

  * end: Returns the state of each Event at end.
    * Each Event response is fully-specified (all fields set).
  * start: Returns the state of each Event at start, followed by updates until now.
    * Each Event response at start is fully-specified, but updates may be partial.
  * start and end: Returns the state of each Event at start, followed by updates
    until end.
    * Each Event response at start is fully-specified, but updates until end may
      be partial.

This field is not allowed in the Subscribe RPC.

value.description:
Value is a value deemed relevant to the initiating request.
This structure will always have its key-field populated. Which other fields are
populated, and why, depends on the value of Operation and what triggered this notification.

time.description: Time holds the timestamp of this Event's last modification.

type.description:
Operation indicates how the Event value in this response should be considered.
Under non-subscribe requests, this value should always be INITIAL. In a subscription,
once all initial data is streamed and the client begins to receive modification updates,
you should not see INITIAL again.

arista.subscriptions.Operation.description:
- INITIAL: INITIAL indicates the associated notification is that of the
current state and a fully-specified Resource is provided.
 - INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE: INITIAL_SYNC_COMPLETE indicates all existing-state has been
streamed to the client. This status will be sent in an
otherwise-empty message and no subsequent INITIAL messages
should be expected.
 - UPDATED: UPDATED indicates the associated notification carries
modification to the last-streamed state. This indicates
the contained Resource may be a partial diff, though, it
may contain a fully-specified Resource.
 - DELETED: DETLETED indicates the associated notification carries
a deletion. The Resource's key will always be set in this case,
but no other fields should be expected.

fmp.DeleteError.description:
DeleteError defines the set of delete error types.

 - DELETE_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED: DELETE_ERROR_UNSPECIFIED indicates that the delete error
is not specified.
 - DELETE_ERROR_UNAUTHORIZED: DELETE_ERROR_UNAUTHORIZED indicates that the user is not authorized
to perform the specified delete.
 - DELETE_ERROR_INTERNAL: DELETE_ERROR_INTERNAL indicates that the server encountered an
unrecoverable error on the specified delete.
 - DELETE_ERROR_UNDELETABLE_KEY: DELETE_ERROR_UNDELETABLE_KEY indicates that the specified error is
not allowed by the service.
